metadata.synopsis: CINE ARTIST - PLEASE CONTACT WRITER! (RUAIRI)The flow looks complex due to integration of an OM, but is relatively simple after the first stage.The first stage is always Nine-Fingers arguing with her underling Uktar, who always leaves before the first player QNs.After that, Jaheira's OM is prioritised, where Nine-Fingers tells her that Minsc is the Stone Lord. The Guild have set a trap to kill him, and she doesn't want Jaheira to interfere.After that, Nine-Fingers introduces herself to the player and can be asked questions about the city. If Jaheira's OM has not triggered yet, that takes priority on any subsequent meetings.

23.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
23.text: Come to derail any other Guild operations? Spit in my eye, perhaps? Or do you just need something?
23.context: NodeContext: Eyes open, friendly, waiting to hear on how we plan to fuck up her operations next

38.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
38.text: It's an orphanage, Uktar. What would you have me do - seize their toys as payment?
38.context: NodeContext: Mid-conversation, but very clearly exasperated with the topic - stating obvious to a subordinate who does not see it

5.speaker: Uktar
5.text: They failed to pay tribute. We should withdraw our protection, at the very least.

81.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
81.text: And cede more ground to the Stone Lord? You're not suggesting I yield a single inch of the city - my city - to this cult?
81.context: NodeContext: Narrowed eyes with an edge in her town

60.speaker: Uktar
60.text: I... We already look weak. If you're seen to be forgiving debts -
60.context: NodeContext: Realizing he's overstepped but trying to make his point nonetheless

293.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
293.text: I didn't say 'forgive'. Seize the building. Arm any children old enough. If they protect what's mine, we'll consider that a start on what's owed.
293.context: NodeContext: Cutting Uktar off. Making it clear she's not soft-hearted - her plan is even more pragmatic than his

50.speaker: Uktar
50.text: ...Yes, guildmaster. I - excuse me? This is a private council.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to notice player mid-way through in shock and anger, making to summon guards.NodeContext: Frustrated but has lost the argument - then indignation as he spots us

118.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
118.text: Keep your underpants clean, Uktar. We're playing host to a hero.
118.context: NodeContext: Amused, unfazed, as if she knew we were there

69.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
69.text: You owe me a gold piece, grandmother.
69.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall. 'Grandmother' is faux-respectful, not overly sentimental

313.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
313.text: When I heard you died out in the wilderness, I made an offering at Kelemvor's well.
313.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall.

85.speaker: Jaheira
85.text: Of gold? I did not know I meant so much to you, guildmaster.
85.context: NodeContext: Playing along, dryly amused. Knows Nine-Fingers well enough to know she is flexing, and letting her get on with it.

220.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
220.text: I'm terribly sentimental. Case in point - I've just let a Harper walk through my Guildhall, noticeably unholed.

267.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
267.text: And with a familiar face in tow.
267.context: NodeContext: Tone sharpening just enough to be threatening - 'I let you walk in, but depending what you say, I might not let you walk out again'

285.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
285.text: Because I'm curious. About why you're here - and who it is you've brought with you.
285.context: NodeContext: Tone sharpening just enough to be threatening - 'I let you walk in, but depending what you say, I might not let you walk out again'

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Well, you already know I'm a friend of Jaheira's.

154.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
154.text: How nice. You won't find many of those in my Guildhall.
154.context: NodeContext: Lightly amused by our earnestness

145.speaker: Jaheira
145.text: We won't tax your hospitality too long, Nine-Fingers. I'm searching for Minsc of Rashemen.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Hi there. I'm a friend of Jaheira's.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: A passer-by. I heard you serve good food down here.

314.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
314.text: Hah! The best in the city, under or above. So smart a mouth as yours would enjoy it, provided you keep all your teeth.
314.context: NodeContext: Genuine bark of a laugh - she appreciates audacity, but is also warning not to go too far

175.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
175.text: Thinking about moving in? I have some lovely lightless cells I could show you.
175.context: NodeContext: Genuine amusement at our audacity, but with an edge.

188.speaker: Jaheira
188.text: This is the one who saved my life. So really, they owe you your gold piece.

90.speaker: Jaheira
90.text: But we can settle debts later, Nine-Fingers. For now, we need help - we're searching for Minsc of Rashemen.

174.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
174.text: A big name, that. Such information does not come cheap, High Harper. Not in normal times.
174.context: NodeContext: A beat of consideration - we've strayed onto a dangerous topic, and it should be clear

55.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
55.text: Of course... seeing as these are not normal times, and we're all such good friends... I'll do better than tell you where he is. I'm bringing him here as we speak.
55.context: NodeContext: Still considering, dangerous. Pitching what's happening as a good thing, but knows we won't see it as such

140.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
140.text: Or - parts of him, at least. I gave no orders about the condition of his corpse.
140.context: NodeContext: Idle, no fanfare to dropping this bombshell - she's telling us she's ordered Minsc's death and won't let us see her sweat over it.

125.speaker: Jaheira
125.text: What treachery is this, Nine-Fingers? Have you thrown in with the Absolute, too?
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't have her draw weapon, but aggressive stance - with Nine-Fingers' guards responding in kind. Heightened tension.NodeContext: Wary, masking the real danger of the situation. Asked idly, but is ready for to fight her way out of an ambush if that's what this is.

337.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
337.text: Against my own city? Careful - you're in very real danger of hurting my feelings.
337.context: NodeContext: Still mild, but an edge coming through - we do NOT want to offend her

37.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
37.text: It's Minsc who's found his faith with Faerûn's newest god. And a new name with it - the Stone Lord.
37.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on Stone Lord is faux-spookiness, not actual emotion

173.speaker: Jaheira
173.context: NodeContext: Quiet hiss - trying to be dismissive, but real anger showing through.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: You say that name as if it means something.

167.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
167.text: It should. My people speak it in the same breath as Sarevok and Demogorgon, but he's just another upstart.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: The Stone Lord? The new gang boss your people are so afraid of?

152.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
152.text: Exactly the one. Guild crews may be prone to exaggeration, but... not in this case.

209.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
209.text: In his short reign, the Stone Lord and his crew have earned a reputation. Pure brutality. No survivors. And where he mows my people down, this ripe little cult takes root.
209.context: NodeContext: Controlled anger - she does not like being put on the back foot

277.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
277.text: But not for much longer. We have word on where he plans to hit next - and he'll find us ready to hit back this time.
277.context: NodeContext: Getting the anger under control - she has it all in hand.

80.speaker: Jaheira
80.text: Nine-Fingers - Astele. Call off your ambush. Tell us where he is, and we'll handle this.
80.context: NodeContext: Urgent - dropping the games and appealing directly to Nine-Fingers with the first name not many know.

131.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
131.text: 'We'? I heard what happened to your Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
131.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

108.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
108.text: 'We'? I see no Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
108.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: She's not alone - she has me.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You really think that will stop her?

114.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
114.text: If you're half the friend you're posing as, you'll tell her that her part in this is done.
114.context: NodeContext: Serious, no act - this is the best thing we could do for Jaheira.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: We can handle this. Trust us.

43.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
43.text: I don't let trust tie my hands. That's why I sit in this very fine office.
43.context: NodeContext: Unmoved by our pleas - she's ruthless, and unapologetic about it

298.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
298.text: The Stone Lord's fate is sealed. We have a bigger war to fight. I'd rather turn our talk to that, but if you need a moment, Jaheira...
298.context: NodeContext: Her mind isn't going to be changed and she's moving on. But her urging for us to keep it is genuinely sincere - she respects Jaheira, and doesn't want this to get ugly.

54.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
54.text: Well, you've earned that much. My Guildhall is open to you. Have a drink, Jaheira. Have a rest.
54.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - she's going to kill our friend, but it's not like she expects us to be happy about it.

176.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
176.text: Just leave well enough alone. It would be a shame for the city to lose two of its heroes in one day.
176.context: NodeContext: A parting warning - she knows Jaheira is almost inevitably going to interfere and is making herself clear. 'Don't make me kill you.'

86.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
86.text: Out of respect for the High Harper, I'm going to pretend you're just scratching your arse.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casual, not even looking at us.NodeContext: Casual, not even looking at us.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: What makes you think he's joined the Absolute? Maybe he just doesn't like thieves.

190.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
190.text: Aye, I considered that. But there's a pattern to his strikes - an intent.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: It makes sense, Jaheira. We know the cult can be... persuasive.

268.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
268.text: Minsc was never one to need much persuading. Not when it came to spilling my people's blood.

310.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
310.text: You owe me a gold piece, grandmother.
310.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall. 'Grandmother' is faux-respectful, not overly sentimental

103.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
103.text: When I heard you died out in the wilderness, I made an offering at Kelemvor's well.
103.context: NodeContext: Idle surprise, as if unconcerned to see Jaheira walk into her hall.

231.speaker: Jaheira
231.text: Of gold? I did not know I meant so much to you, guildmaster.

297.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
297.text: I'm terribly sentimental. Case in point - I've just let a Harper walk through my Guildhall, noticeably unholed.

340.speaker: Jaheira
340.text: I won't tax your hospitality too long, Nine-Fingers. I'm searching for Minsc of Rashemen.

237.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
237.text: A big name, that. Such information does not come cheap, High Harper. Not in normal times.
237.context: NodeContext: A beat of consideration - we've strayed onto a dangerous topic, and it should be clear

123.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
123.text: Of course... seeing as these are not normal times, and we're all such good friends... I'll do better than tell you where he is. I'm bringing him here as we speak.
123.context: NodeContext: Still considering, dangerous. Pitching what's happening as a good thing, but knows we won't see it as such

49.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
49.text: Or - parts of him, at least. I gave no orders about the condition of his corpse.
49.context: NodeContext: Idle, no fanfare to dropping this bombshell - she's telling us she's ordered Minsc's death and won't let us see her sweat over it.

149.speaker: Jaheira
149.text: What treachery is this, Nine-Fingers? Have you thrown in with the Absolute, too?
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't have her draw weapon, but aggressive stance - with Nine-Fingers' guards responding in kind. Heightened tension.NodeContext: Wary, masking the real danger of the situation. Asked idly, but is ready for to fight her way out of an ambush if that's what this is.

79.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
79.text: Against my own city? Careful - you're in very real danger of hurting my feelings.
79.context: NodeContext: Still mild, but an edge coming through - we do NOT want to offend her

203.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
203.text: It's Minsc who's found his faith with Faerûn's newest god. And a new name with it - the Stone Lord.
203.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on Stone Lord is faux-spookiness, not actual emotion

64.speaker: Jaheira
64.context: NodeContext: Quiet hiss - trying to be dismissive, but real anger showing through.

271.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
271.text: In his short reign, the Stone Lord and his crew have earned a reputation. Pure brutality. No survivors. And where he mows my people down, this ripe little cult takes root.
271.context: NodeContext: Controlled anger - she does not like being put on the back foot

68.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
68.text: But not for much longer. We have word on where he plans to hit next - and he'll find us ready to hit back this time.
68.context: NodeContext: Getting the anger under control - she has it all in hand.

215.speaker: Jaheira
215.text: Nine-Fingers - Astele. Call off your ambush. Tell us where he is, and we'll handle this.
215.context: NodeContext: Urgent - dropping the games and appealing directly to Nine-Fingers with the first name not many know.

172.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
172.text: 'We'? I heard what happened to your Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
172.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

115.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
115.text: 'We'? I see no Harpers, Jaheira. I'm sorry - but this fight's too big for you alone.
115.context: NodeContext: A very slight softening - not pity, or even mercy, but understanding. She respects Jaheira even as an opponent, but doesn't like seeing her helpless. Trying to drive the knife home gently.

319.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
319.text: The Stone Lord's fate is sealed. We have a bigger war to fight. I'd rather turn our talk to that, but if you need a moment, Jaheira...
319.context: NodeContext: Her mind isn't going to be changed and she's moving on. But her urging for us to keep it is genuinely sincere - she respects Jaheira, and doesn't want this to get ugly.

65.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
65.text: Just leave well enough alone. It would be a shame for the city to lose two of its heroes in one day.
65.context: NodeContext: A parting warning - she knows Jaheira is almost inevitably going to interfere and is making herself clear. 'Don't make me kill you.'

74.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
74.text: You recall our reports of Ketheric Thorm? General of the Absolute, champion of Myrkul, unkillable-tyrant-of-Moonrise?
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfazed, turning to look at player as if we were expected. Appraises us while still addressing Uktar.NodeContext: Appraising us, listing Ketheric's titles as if bored with them

39.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
39.text: Meet the one who killed him.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a casual 'ta-da' gesture.NodeContext: A modicum more respect in this simple introduction than for all Ketheric's titles

236.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
236.text: Was it the Harper who tipped you off, or something else?
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deadpan, holding up her hand to display the missing finger.NodeContext: Deadpan, amused

78.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
78.text: A little less impressive, as revelations go.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deadpan, holding up her hand to display the missing finger.NodeContext: Deadpan, amused

110.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
110.text: You'll forgive the spying, I hope. The Guild keeps watch for anyone of interest passing through our gates.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: I don't want to talk about me. I want to talk about Minsc.

292.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
292.text: And when we're sitting in your stronghold, I'll give a good slippery shite about what you want.
292.context: NodeContext: Sharp, letting her anger show - not freaking out, just putting us in our place before returning to her normal tone.

224.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
224.text: You're with the Harper, so you already know there's a war coming. And I already know the only thing about you that I need to.
224.context: NodeContext: Laying out the reason we're natural allies.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: Am I interrupting? Your guards just let me pass.

62.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
62.text: Of course. They knew you were expected.

299.speaker: Player
299.text: How do you know who I am?

249.speaker: Player
249.text: My fame precedes me. That, or you've been spying on me.

10.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
10.text: Whichever one gives you the most comfort.

208.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
208.text: The Guild is this city's first and last line of defence. It's only natural that we watch the gates for anyone interesting.

191.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
191.text: I'd say you qualify. I already know the only thing about you that I need to.
191.context: NodeContext: Not overly complimentary - just stating facts

92.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
92.text: You've crossed paths with the cult's leadership before, and you're still standing.
92.context: NodeContext: Not overly complimentary - just stating facts. 'Not bad'.

210.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
210.text: I mean to burn the Absolute from the face of my city. So if you mean to help, congratulations - we just became the best of friends.
210.context: NodeContext: Challenge in her tone. She loves her city, and hates those who presume to push in on her power even more.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: You seem to know quite a bit about the cult.

290.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
290.text: As, it seems, do you. I already know the only thing about you that I need to.
290.context: NodeContext: Not overly complimentary - just stating facts

41.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
41.text: Ah. You're the one working with the Harper.
41.context: NodeContext: Casual, is unfazed if we appear after her confrontation with Jaheira and know who she is.

48.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
48.text: I knew Jaheira was back in the city - alive and kicking and with a new friend in tow. Your exploits together are causing quite a stir.
48.context: NodeContext: Friendly greeting, but slowly letting her anger seep through - in this case, we're meeting her for the first time, but she knows we foiled her ambush against Minsc

1.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
1.text: I thought you'd come to Baldur's Gate to finish the job you started at Moonrise.
1.context: NodeContext: Faux puzzlement: ' please explain the dumb thing you did, because I'm sure there's some secret genius to it'

280.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
280.text: So tell me - why would you kill Ketheric and chase his co-conspirators to the city, only to turn on us at the last moment? Why let Minsc get away?
280.context: NodeContext: Faux puzzlement: ' please explain the dumb thing you did, because I'm sure there's some secret genius to it'

323.speaker: Player
323.text: I didn't turn on anyone - but Minsc is not the enemy.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: I'm here to stop the Absolute. I won't be questioned by you.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Wait - how do you know who I am?

105.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
105.text: It's my business. And not what should concern you most right now.

99.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
99.text: The Stone Lord - Minsc - is the Absolute's enforcer-in-chief. Every piece of territory he takes from me goes to the cult.

134.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
134.text: You are apparently the city's best chance of sending the Absolute packing. So yes - I need you alive.

82.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
82.text: We meet at last. Your exploits are causing quite a stir.
82.context: NodeContext: Friendly greeting, but slowly letting her anger seep through - in this case, we're meeting her for the first time, but she knows we foiled her ambush against Minsc

111.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
111.text: You have a cult to kill. What do you need from me to do it?

226.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
226.text: You keep good company. But don't think you can hide from me in the Harper's shadow.

44.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
44.text: I hear things, in my work. Like the rise of General Ketheric Thorm, Chosen of Myrkul, unkillable-tyrant-of-Moonrise.

281.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
281.text: And I hear you're the one who killed him.

126.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
126.text: I knew you'd try and stick your beak in, Harper. You can't help yourself.
126.context: NodeContext: The very first time she's seeing Jaheira - in this flow, we went and fucked up Nine-Fingers' trap before even speaking to her. She's pissed off and keeping it contained, but not afraid to let us know we're in danger.

212.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
212.text: You had a grand plan to save Minsc from big bad Nine-Fingers. So why did you let him escape?
212.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - surely Jaheira had a good reason for messing up her trap

136.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
136.text: We haven't known each other for very long, so perhaps I ought to clarify.
136.context: NodeContext: Casual, but boiling with fury underneath

91.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
91.text: When I say 'Don't interfere, or else' - most people avoid finding out what 'or else' means.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I suppose I was just curious.

157.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
157.text: Curious by nature, are you? Ever wondered what it's like to have your skin peeled off?
157.context: NodeContext: Not letting our joke get under her skin, restating her threat

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I told you Jaheira and I would handle it. Just let us.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: I told you we would handle it. Let us.

250.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
250.text: Rather than stuffing you in a box and dropping you into the river, you mean?
250.context: NodeContext: Casual, but boiling with fury underneath

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Your ambush was a complete failure - and it would've been worse if we hadn't been there.

153.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
153.text: You think so? Perhaps I'll buy a better mimic - test it on you, hm?
153.context: NodeContext: Casual, but boiling with fury underneath

156.speaker: Jaheira
156.text: No threats, Astele. We are your allies, whether you want to see it or not.

96.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
96.text: You're still the city's best chance of sending the Absolute packing. So, yes - I need you. I even like you.
96.context: NodeContext: Sighing, bringing temper under control, pragamatic. Should still be furious and not hiding that from us, but getting on with it

61.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
61.text: But know that I do not need or like anyone so much that I will let them cross me twice.
61.context: NodeContext: This is our final warning

11.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
11.text: You want to handle Minsc? Then handle him - before I do.
11.context: NodeContext: This is our final warning

151.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
151.text: Keep the Harper out of trouble. Just because I don't want to kill her doesn't mean I won't.
151.context: NodeContext: Deadly serious about her threat, and trying to make us believe it so she doesn't actually have to follow through

94.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
94.text: Beyond that - be welcome, be merry. Is there something you require of a humble guildmaster?

205.speaker: Player
205.text: That story you told Minsc - was any of it true?

89.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
89.text: You can't just swallow every bit of story-book tripe that you hear. Do I strike you as a lost little girl looking for a hero?
89.context: NodeContext: Scoffing - in a standoff with Minsc, she told him how he was a hero of hers growing up. Dismissing it now.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *Nine-Fingers Keene, feared guildmaster, is a woman of many masks. And yet with Minsc, you suspect you saw a little truth slip through.*

13.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
13.text: Now lose the stupid look on your face, and tell me what you need.
13.context: NodeContext: Blunt, changing the topic from her story about being a child sheltering beneath Minsc's statue

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Minsc went from an enemy to an asset. You're welcome.

8.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
8.text: Enemies and assets are all the Guild know. Don't think I won't use him.
8.context: NodeContext: Correcting our assumption that she won't be happy to use Minsc if he can help her

165.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
165.text: If the Rashemaar wants to work off a blood-debt, I won't turn him down. He scares my kingpins shitless.
165.context: NodeContext: Correcting our assumption that she won't be happy to use Minsc if he can help her

138.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
138.text: My Guild was too fractured to stand up to the Absolute - too corrupt to see the threat within. I reckon a little bit of hamster-talk might be good for them.
138.context: NodeContext: Correcting our assumption that she won't be happy to use Minsc if he can help her

238.speaker: Jaheira
238.text: And you're sure you'll handle Minsc so easily as that?
238.context: NodeContext: Wry, mock sincerity - Jaheira knows how hard Minsc is to guide sometimes

255.speaker: Minsc
255.text: What? I was trying to spy a nice warm spot for Boo's bedding.
255.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, absolutely was not listening to Jaheira and Nine-Fingers discuss him.

14.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
14.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - she thinks she can handle Minsc easily

112.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
112.text: We need to survive the fight to come, first. So let's save our talk for a bright new day, hm?

187.speaker: Player
187.text: What can I do to help you?

332.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
332.text: Kill the Absolute, and keep the big bald berserker out of trouble. We'll find out if either of those things is possible.
332.context: NodeContext: Wry - that one task is plenty

168.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
168.context: NodeContext: Keeping a lid on her fury - we botched an operation of hers (or at the very least, were present for its botching - she sees little difference)

309.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
309.text: Do any more, and the Guild might have to take a special interest in you. Understood? Great.
309.context: NodeContext: Tightly controlled anger - a threat to let us know the matter is closed

214.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
214.text: I've already told you. The Stone Lord's planning to walk into my Counting House. Make sure he doesn't walk out again.
214.context: NodeContext: Reminding us what she asked us to do

33.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
33.text: Keep me from having to kill the Harper. Which means keeping out of the Guild's way - all right? Wonderful!
33.context: NodeContext: Reminding us of what she asked. Faux cheerfulness at the end to let us know the matter is settled

318.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
318.text: I need to see Jaheira. Just so happens, she'll want to see me too.
318.context: NodeContext: Reminding us of what she asked

148.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
148.text: I was planning to soften you up a bit first, but - straight to business, then.
148.context: NodeContext: 'Straight to business that easily? Fair enough then'

143.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
143.text: Of all the pains in my arse the Absolute has delivered, one in particular keeps growing. A new gang boss who calls himself the Stone Lord.

274.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
274.text: If he was just another upstart who didn't like paying Guild dues, fair enough. But he and his crew make no demands, leave no survivors to pass on a message.
274.context: NodeContext: Relaying the threat the Stone Lord poses

266.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
266.text: All I know is that on every scrap of ground he takes from me, the cult of the Absolute soon starts sprouting.

135.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
135.text: He's a prick, whoever he prays to.
135.context: NodeContext: Uncaring of who the Stone Lord serves

200.speaker: Player
200.text: And you want this to become my problem.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I think you've mistaken me for one of your paid enforcers.

121.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
121.text: I never actually said anything about paying you. Though if it's coin you're after, well - you'll like this next part.

336.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
336.text: We know where he plans to hit next - a little operation the Guild have running in the city's Counting House.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I encountered a crew of his fighting your people down by the seafront.

324.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
324.text: Aye. Transport corridors. Not the most glamorous targets, but without the vine, the cherries shrivel and die.

305.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
305.text: We know he plans on something higher profile next - a little operation the Guild has running in the Counting House.

189.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
189.text: Likely my crew has it in hand - snare set, ready to draw it tight. But I like a little certainty - and you've dealt with bigger bastards, handily enough.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Hold on. The Guild has an operation inside the city's bank?

130.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
130.text: Might be more accurate to say the Guild is the city's bank. We bought them out years back - perfectly legitimate. As I said, I like a little certainty.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: I'll head over and check it out.

242.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
242.text: Obliged. Shouldn't pose any problem for you.

341.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
341.text: In return - if I can offer aid, information, just ask.

338.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
338.text: As you like. I always do. My welcome stands - maybe I'm just nicer than you are.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: I hear you. But I wanted to discuss something else.

51.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
51.text: You've been seen with a certain Harper. Grey of hair, somewhat spiky of manner?
51.context: NodeContext: Describing someone she knows we know

253.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
253.text: We're practically sisters! So much so, I even stopped trying to have her killed a few years back.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: 'Somewhat spiky'? In the same way a morningstar is, yes.

47.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
47.context: NodeContext: Wry - we've described Jaheira's temper well

321.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
321.text: I need to speak with her. She's still getting the lay of the land, I expect - I have information that might help with that.

193.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
193.text: So remind her to pay an old friend a visit, would you?

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Can't you just tell me, and I'll pass word along?

300.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
300.text: I could, but she wouldn't thank either of us for that. Trust me.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: She tells me next to nothing either. I see why you two get along.

9.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
9.text: Oh, I never said that we get along.

328.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
328.text: Now - is there anything else you need?

325.speaker: Player
325.text: I need some information from you first.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: I can do that. I'll bring her back here.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: You better not let 'a certain Harper' hear that description.

282.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
282.text: Unless she's taken to dyeing her hair, I'd call it accurate enough.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: That doesn't sound like anyone I know. Sorry.

239.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
239.text: Hm. One of the things I like about Jaheira - for all her Harper wiles, she's not much of a liar. You're a little better.
239.context: NodeContext: Considering. She sees through our bullshit and is letting us know

229.speaker: Player
229.text: Just tell me what you want with her.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Why do I need the Guild? I've been doing well enough without you so far.

276.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
276.text: You have, but don't be so quick to bat away a helping hand. You'll find few enough of them in this city.
276.context: NodeContext: Amused at our self-belief - not dismissing it, but knows no one can fight the Absolute alone

87.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
87.text: The Flaming Fist can be bought, the Harpers are scattered, and the Parliament of Peers... well, they're just generally too inbred to be useful.
87.context: NodeContext: Listing all the various flawed insitutions she dismisses

102.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
102.text: The Absolute's at our gate, and the Guild are the only ones truly standing against it.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: You can help a companion of mine who needs information - Jaheira.

109.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
109.text: I wasn't surprised to learn you two had fallen in together. I could make a guess at what she needs from me, too.

304.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
304.text: Bring her here. Whatever questions she has, she'll want to hear the answers directly from me.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: We're not done discussing Minsc. Call off your ambush.

147.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
147.text: No begging? Not even a snotty little 'please'? It's almost like you don't know who you're talking to.
147.context: NodeContext: Arched eyebrow - tone is unfazed, but we're beginning to piss her off. Hint of quiet threat in 'you don't know who you're talking to'

132.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
132.text: The order's been given. It's done. So I hope you know another tune, because I'm getting bored of this one.
132.context: NodeContext: Arched eyebrow - tone is unfazed, but we're beginning to piss her off. This topic is off=limits to her

155.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
155.text: Knowing what I know usually comes at a cost. But let's say we'll put it on your tab.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: How is it you know so much about the cult of the Absolute and its leaders?

16.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
16.text: Simple enough. After Jaheira warned me - and then disappeared - I went nosing into the cult for myself.
16.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - espionage is no big deal to her, she hears everything eventually - whether through informants or donning disguises and infiltrating the enemy herself

144.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
144.text: I could bore you with the details. How I found evidence of Gortash's projects, traced him to Orin the Red, and made a safe bet there was some dried out old necromancer to round out the three.
144.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - espionage is no big deal to her, she hears everything eventually - whether through informants or donning disguises and infiltrating the enemy herself

288.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
288.text: Because it's always the Dead bloody Three - has-been half-gods who can't help but make their irrelevance everyone else's problem.
288.context: NodeContext: Quiet eye-rolling at the dead three - they're three particular gods who always target her city, and always end up being foiled.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: There's more to it than just the Dead Three.

296.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
296.text: Oh? You've got some juicy little tidbit I haven't heard yet?
296.context: NodeContext: Actual interest - rare enough for her to hear something she doesn't already know

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Tell her everything. The enslaved elder brain, the Astral Prism - you.

18.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
18.context: NodeContext: Grunt of mute surprise. An anticlimactic response to the world-shattering secret we just told her about about the Absolute being a Dead Three / illithid conspiracy

245.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
245.context: NodeContext: Slightly more inflected grunt of mute surprise.

160.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
160.text: It seems like my intelligence on you was patchy, at best. That's annoying.
160.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering us - less annoyed at the world-ending threat we just told her about, more annoyed that she didn't already know about it

221.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
221.text: Don't pout. For a brief second, I did weigh the odds on killing you.
221.context: NodeContext: Amused at our irritiation at how calmly she took the news that we're infected

256.speaker: Player
256.text: So what do you plan to do, now that you know?

4.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
4.text: I had no intention of leaving my city in the Dead Three's hands. I'm definitely not leaving it to some slimy shit that doesn't even have hands.
4.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - our big secret doesn't change the war she has to fight

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Don't overreact. I'm in control of myself, I swear it.

161.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
161.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, unfazed - her calmness isn't an assumption we can't or won't turn against her, just a grim acceptance that if it happens she'll deal with it

286.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
286.text: But if there's a tainted elder brain slopping around below my city, I think we need one another more than ever.

169.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
169.text: So long as you can keep a lid on what's growing inside you, we're allies. Until you can't, and we're not.
169.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - our big secret doesn't change the war she has to fight

317.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
317.text: Simple enough, I reckon. Now - war to be fought. You need anything?
317.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - our big secret doesn't change the war she has to fight

240.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
240.text: Right. Well. War to be fought - do you need anything else?

312.speaker: Player
312.text: Who is this Stone Lord that has your Guild running scared?

254.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
254.text: The leader of some new crew that's intent on paining my arse.

233.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
233.text: Doesn't matter. Whatever god the prick prays to, I'll send him to meet it soon enough.

331.speaker: Player
331.text: How's your fight against the Absolute going?

329.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
329.text: Hah. Which part? The Stone Lord's hollowed this place out - half my crews are fled or in hiding.
329.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

29.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
29.text: Orin's Faceless try to pierce my ranks every day, while Gortash's toy soldiers control the streets.
29.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

227.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
227.text: When the Absolute's army arrives to wage war on the city, our best hope is to make sure they have no leaders in here willing to open the gates for them.
227.context: NodeContext: Just plainly stating the job we have to do

333.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
333.text: You've dealt with Orin, but Gortash still clutters my streets with his toy soldiers.
333.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

258.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
258.text: You might have removed Gortash, but Orin's Faceless are still circling.
258.context: NodeContext: Grim amusement - we've asked for an update on a terrible situation

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You and Jaheira are an odd pairing. How do you know one another?

244.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
244.text: We've crossed paths over the years. Two hands trying to steer the city - just not always in the same direction.
244.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Jaheira, for whom she has equal parts admiration as a fellow protector of the city (as she sees it), and irritation for being a do-gooder who gets in her way

164.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
164.text: I can't stand Harpers, as a rule, but Jaheira's the exception. She's only really half a Harper at most.

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: You mean that as a compliment, I am sure.

243.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
243.text: The same way I'm not just the lowly thief, vagabond, and murderer the Watch and Peers would paint me as. I happen to be a fine singer, too.
243.context: NodeContext: Listing off all the aspects of her terrible reputation, humourously making the point that there's more to her than that.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I noticed the mercenaries in your hall. Since when does the Guild work with the Zhentarim?

36.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
36.text: We don't. The Zhentarim work for me. Time was I'd charge the bastards double if I let them into my hall at all, but times change.
36.context: NodeContext: Distaste - we've broached a topic she's not pleased to talk about, but will

247.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
247.text: The Guild is many things, but it's not an army. If the Absolute keeps pushing in on our territory, then I need a little weight to push back.
247.context: NodeContext: Distaste - we've broached a topic she's not pleased to talk about, but will

334.speaker: Player
334.text: I'd like to know more about the Guild.

116.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
116.text: Thieves, frauds, and miscreants - if it's just the Watch warrants you're reading.
116.context: NodeContext: Eyes wide, faux-alarm as she recites all the tropes about her criminal guild

93.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
93.text: The Guild isn't any one thing. We're everything - all the parts of the city the Watch don't want seen, so they push us to the far side of their law.
93.context: NodeContext: Quiet, defiant pride - the image she paints of the Guild is one that the city's upper crust would scoff at, but one she fervently believes in

269.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
269.text: But it's not that Watch that keeps the peace, or gives justice to any Baldurian who asks, whether they can pay for it or not. It's us.
269.context: NodeContext: Quiet, defiant pride - the image she paints of the Guild is one that the city's upper crust would scoff at, but one she fervently believes in

252.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
252.text: If we take a little tribute in return, or tie strings of service to those we help, well - what of it? So long as we're working as one, it all runs quick, quiet, and clean.
252.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging the Guild's criminal aspects, not shying away

241.speaker: Player
241.text: That's a very utopian way of saying you're a gang of petty thugs.

15.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
15.text: If you'd prefer to trust in the Watch, the Council, the Parliament of Peers - by all means. They're the pretty face slapped over the city.

195.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
195.text: But the Guild is the blood, the bone, the gristle - the ugly bits that actually make Baldur's Gate move.

117.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
117.text: We'll be the ones still holding the Gate when all those others have fled.
117.context: NodeContext: Quiet certainty - this is true, because she will make it so

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I'd trust the Guild over the City Watch and the Flaming Fist any day.

278.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
278.text: The Watch, the Council, even the Parliament of Peers - they're the clean face they want the world to see.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: And what is it the Guild wants?

186.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
186.text: Clean water, filthy riches, and everything in between. We're citizens of the city - no more, no less.

32.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
32.text: Right now, I'll settle for taking our city back.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: I ran into some of your thugs - the Rivington Rats?

52.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
52.text: Oh? Did you enjoy the encounter?
52.context: NodeContext: Raised brows, wry- we're telling us about a crew of her we ran into.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I had to kill the leader.

141.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
141.text: Zenovia? Always told the girl that mouth would cost her her head.
141.context: NodeContext: Sighing - a young lieutentant of hers attacked us

104.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
104.text: I could wish you'd shown some restraint, but I doubt she'd have returned it.
104.context: NodeContext: Sighing, shrugging - the thug of hers we killed had it coming

270.speaker: Player
270.text: They got a payday out of me.

24.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
24.text: A charitable donation to the good protectors of Rivington - was that the tune they played you?
24.context: NodeContext: Amused - we got scammed by her people

228.speaker: Player
228.text: I don't think they enjoyed it.

197.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
197.text: I have no doubt you gave them a good talking to.
197.context: NodeContext: Wry, grimly amused - player scared the shit out of them

201.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
201.text: Am I supposed to swear vengeance? I heard they'd grown a little... indiscreet.
201.context: NodeContext: Raised brows - we just told her we killed her people

77.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
77.text: Bottom-feeding bruisers, I think you mean.

315.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
315.text: But it takes thugs to keep order outside the walls. The Fist only go there for good lawless fun.
315.context: NodeContext: Acknowleding that her people are thugs, but it's thugs she needs in that neighborhood

273.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
273.text: The Rats usually kept a lid on their nastier notions, but with the Stone Lord business distracting me... some are starting to test the leash.
273.context: NodeContext: Rueful - her control is slipping because of the cult

234.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
234.text: All the more reason to be rid of the cult quickly, so I can remind my crews it's not a leash 'round their necks if they cross me - it's a noose.

196.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
196.text: No time! The Zhentarim have turned, the rot-word bastards. So if you're part of it, take your shot - anything else can wait 'til the Zhent are buried.
196.context: NodeContext: Grim, focused - the Zhent have turned on her and we've found our way into her office

265.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
265.text: Good. Because I've already got more enemies than I do fingers.
265.context: NodeContext: 'Oh, how nice you're not going to kill me today'

3.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
3.context: NodeContext: Without further ado, leading us into the fight

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Nothing personal. The Guild just needs a new master.

30.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
30.text: I disagree. Let's have a friendly debate on the matter, aye?
30.context: NodeContext: Smiling - almost relieved to just get to something as simple as a fight to the death

213.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
213.text: I suppose I should have seen that coming. Zhentarim aren't known for their loyalty, but I thought the bastards would keep to their contract at least.
213.context: NodeContext: Spitting, disdain for the Zhentarim and her own naivety in actually trusting them

124.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
124.text: I'm too nice for my own good, I suppose. But I was in a pit and you helped pull me out - for that, I'm grateful.

137.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
137.text: You'll have what Guild blades I can give when the time to take the Absolute comes. So just tell me what you need to get us there.

217.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
217.text: All hail the Absolute's worst nightmare. How can I help you in your war today?
217.context: NodeContext: Dry. 'Look at this big bad hero'

248.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
248.text: You still look like you need a rest, grandmother. Anything I can do to take that wrinkle from your brow?
248.context: NodeContext: Sourly amused, certain Jaheira is about to be a pain her arse somehow.
